title: Verify that Zero Value Service Charge with Unpaid Status  is not created if add tickets to a delivery with more than one order and a charge in context

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. pre-requisite should met
2. 2 reservation created
3. order claimed in same delivery
4. Order payed
5. Edit service charge
6. Seats added in order no 2,added delivery charge and then move to receivable
7. Order 1 will now be returned
8. Service charge status shouldn't be unpaid if charge is created with $0 value
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Pre-requisite:

Pre-requisite, a Postal delivery with no service charge in context.
Expected Result:
pre-requisite should met
2. Create 2 reservations for Order 1 and Order 2
Expected Result:
2 reservation created
3. Claim Order 1 and 2 together in a single transaction and assign to the same Delivery ? Mail, assign both orders to a 
receivable.
Expected Result:
order claimed in same delivery
4. Pay off order1 ? do not print
Expected Result:
Order payed
5. Enable service charge for the Mail delivery used, fixed amount, editable
Expected Result:
Edit service charge
6. Add seats to Order 2, edit delivery charge to $0, put monies to a receivable, checkout
Expected Result:
Seats added in order no 2,added delivery charge and then move to receivable
7. Run validation check for 6.2.3.2
  select *
  from service_charge_item sci
  where sci.payment_status_code in ('U','P')
  and sci.actual_amount = 0;
Expected Result:
Order 1 will now be returned
8. Verify that Zero Value Service Charge with Unpaid Status  is not created  for order no 1, if add tickets to a delivery 
with more than one order and a charge in context
Expected Result:
Service charge status shouldn't be unpaid if charge is created with $0 value

title: Verify whether user able to create service charge when user with configMgmt role with Groups having owning organization different from the logged in agency?s org

service charge

1. Pre-requisite:
 
1. Create a new Report Group and 
Associated Tixx-Tickets.com as Owning 
Organization

2. Create a New Print Service Group and 
associated TIXX ? Tickets.com as Owning 
Organization.

Pre-requisite should be completed successfully
2. Launch PV application using credentials having configmgmt role
Expected Result:
PV application should launched successfully
3. Navigate to Service Charge Groups (User Interface, Report, Print Groups) and associate a owning organization.
Expected Result:
Navigated to Service Charge Groups and Associated a owning organization successfully
4. Make note of the owning organization and use the same while creating service charge.
Expected Result:
User should use same owning organization which we used for Report Group and Print service Group
5. Create a new service charge and associate the above noted owning organization.
Expected Result:
The Service charge should created successfully
6. Select the User Interface, Report, Print Groups associated with the owning organization.
Expected Result:
User Interface, Report, Print Groups should associated with the owning organization
7. Click on apply changes
Expected Result:
Clicked on apply changes.
8. Verify whether user able to create service charge when user with configMgmt role with Groups having owning 
organization different from the logged in agency?s org
Expected Result:
By selecting the Owning Organization with the associated Service Charge Groups, system should allow user to create 
service charge

title: Verify Price scale limited service charges is caching immediately

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Application should be launched successfully.
2. Service charge portal should be dispalyed
3. Copy  of a Ticket inclusive service charge (A) should be completed and new service charge B should be created 
successfully
4. service charge code should be updated successfully
5. context should be displayed
6. Supplier should be added
7. The Price sclae tab should be clicked and the 
place to select the Price sales shoudl be 
displayed and updated
8. All the price scale noted in the pre requisite shoud be dipslayed correctly with active status and should display for the 
order immediately
9. Fee should be correctly charged
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Launch the PV apllication.
Login with valid credetials
Expected Result:
Application should be launched successfully.
2. Navigate to service charges by select the same from the system setup dropdown
Expected Result:
Service charge portal should be dispalyed
3. Copy  a Ticket inclusive service charge (A) by clicking on the copy button of any inclusive service charge and create 
Service Charge B
Expected Result:
Copy  of a Ticket inclusive service charge (A) should be completed and new service charge B should be created 
successfully
4. Change code an amount on Service Charge B and click on apply changes
Expected Result:
service charge code should be updated successfully
5. Edit the context rules of that service charge by 
clicking on the Edit button
Expected Result:
context should be displayed
6. 1.Selet a supplier and include the same.
Expected Result:
Supplier should be added
7. Navigate to price scale tab by clicking the tab
and Update the price scale in context (since 
the fee was only charged for one scale) by 
clicking on apply changes button
Expected Result:
The Price sclae tab should be clicked and the 
place to select the Price sales shoudl be 
displayed and updated
8. 1. Change fee from INACTIVE to ACTIVE and click on Apply Changes 
2. Add a space to description and click on  Apply Changes
3. Reoffer an order, fee is correctly pulled into context
Expected Result:
All the price scale noted in the pre requisite shoud be dipslayed correctly with active status and should display for the 
order immediately
9. Repeated steps 1-8 above for a new fee (copy B to C, adjust for new price scale in context), reoffer a new order
Expected Result:
Fee should be correctly charged

title: Reservation-Verify whether a One-Time use limit service charge is applied without any capping  to all event reservation transaction even if the service charge is already charged for the same patron in another event reservation transaction in the de

custom_steps_separated.content:

8. Verify SC is associated with the first transaction.
9. SC should be associated with both transactions.

"All orders which contain reservation-only tickets that are in context for the one-time use limit service charge will have the service charge assigned without any capping. 

For example, two transactions for the same financial patron account have the same one-time use limit service charge in context for tickets that are reserved; the service charge would remain uncapped in both transactions.  Only when the reservation is claimed will the one-time use limit service charge be capped if it is already in use in another sale."
